name: 5 Past World's End
description:
[------------ DESCRIPTION ------------]

A game developed in 7 days as a challenge to myself. The inspiration
for the game was obtained from the game jam theme generator, and the
first thing that came up was: The World Ends in 5 Minutes

So, you are a time engineer, responsible for overlooking and maintaining
the world clock, a clock that tells the world's time (in the literal
sense, as in, if you change the clock the time of the world changes).
In your latest turn, you overslept, and the clock malfunctioned, when
you woke up, the clock was at 5 minutes to midnight for the second
time in the same day... Now, you have to engage the clock safety
recovery system, which is, for some reason, a set of five levers
protected with security puzzle. 

No time to waste, go save the world!

[------------ HOW TO PLAY ------------]
- esc = pause / unpause / exit puzzle
- w/a/s/d = walk / navigate options
- e = interact / select

When the game starts there is a timer of 5 minutes and 5 levers beneath it.
The objective is to press all the 5 levers, but in order to unlock each lever,
you have to complete a small puzzle. 

There are 5 puzzles that can be found around the room and each puzzle unlocks a 
single lever. Beware, leaving or losing a puzzle will grant you a penalization
of 30 seconds.

GUESSING SEQUENCE:
    There is a sequence of 4 numbers, and one is hidden. Select the correct number
    from the options given below

NAVIGATION:
    There are to round entry tubes, rotate the remaining pipes in order to form
    a path for the water from the starting entry point to the exit point

MEMORY SEQUENCE:
    A sequence will play using the keys "w/a/s/d", after the sequence has ended,
    repeat it

LEVER ORDER:
    A series of 5 levers that must all be turned on in 15 seconds to proceed. The
    levers may activate/deactivate others so you have to find the order in which
    to press them

REACTION EVENT:
    A sequence of 8 keys ("w/a/s/d") will pass from on end of the screen to the
    other. You have to press them timely while they are inside the green cursor in
    the middle, otherwise the puzzle fails

[------------ NOTES ------------]

The game is somewhat unfinished, but the challenge was for 7 days. However, if I receive comments with feedback and ideas I'll be sure to improve the game on next releases, after all, I still want to have a final release at 1.0.0 xP
